Reviews.Title: It's marginal for me + 3 week update
Reviews.Author: J. nusser
Reviews.Content: It's between 2 stars (I don't like it) and 3 stars (it's OK).  I bought it on the strength of the NY Times story and paid about $90 including shipping for the red version. For $9.24 shipping it came UPS Ground from the west coast, in 8 days from placing the order.I've been using the Ematic for a day or so. It works; it does many things well or at least OK, but it's slow, very slow.Pluses:It's got mostly intuitive controls. It runs android apps. I like the integration with google applications and syncing with same on my other devices. It runs a Sonos app which is a big plus for us since we have it at our home.  (I tried a Samsung Chromebook; it won't run sonos as of early May 2013.)  Another plus is the Kindle app you download.  It lets me read the same books I have on a separate kindle, on ematic.  It works really well.Cons:  Slow, frustratingly slow, esp using the chrome browser.  The touch screen really lags in chrome; can be several seconds or more; especially frustrating when typing.  I wind up pressing several times and waiting.  There's no sensitivity controls for the touch screen that I can find.  I looked for them after learning the screen does not always respond to my taps. In some instances I find myself pushing on the screen rather than tapping since it appears not to respond. When typing, it frequently enters a foreign alphabet character, like an accented e or o.  I tried to see if Firefox would run faster than chrome.  I downloaded FF and got a format "not supported" message.  Not a surprise, but want to note that it runs android not other formats.  Screen contrast and sharpness are marginal.As others have mentioned, its not bad for having around the house as a tool to run a timer, do a quick check on mail or the net, read a book, etc.  Take it on a trip or use as a main device?  Not for me.You get what you pay for in this case. It's an inexpensive tablet. It works.  You'll probably be frustrated, as I am after only one day.  I'd suggest paying more and getting more.3 week update:May 24, 2013:  I've been using it for 3 weeks now.  I would return it if I could.  Works well as a kindle reader, Sonos controller, and some android games.  As a browser its so slow, its useless or freezes completely.  Available storage is so limited I continually get out of memory system notices. No idea how to remedy them, maybe buy a memory card? That wipes out the advantage of low price?  Won't really run other android apps like NYTimes, Wall St Journal, etc.  Just freezes.Can anyone else who bought one comment on speed, freezes, etc?  Did I get a lemon or is this just not an adequate tablet beyond the reader and sonos functions?

Reviews.Title: Good if you use Opera Mini browser
Reviews.Author: Customer
Reviews.Content: I just bought this Ematic tablet today.  Chrome is too slow.  "Opera Mini" is the fastest browser for this tablet because it condenses websites before downloading them.  You can get Opera Mini from "Play Store".  As long as you use Opera Mini, this tablet is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: 80 Bucks for a tablet
Reviews.Author: Jane's Addiction
Reviews.Content: *****This review is orignally from NY Times*****This Tablet's Top Attraction? Its $80 Price.By ROY FURCHGOTTIf you're not sure that you need a tablet, $200 is a lot to spend just to find out. But Ematic has reduced the risk with the Genesis Prime, a 7-inch Android tablet computer that lists for $80.You get quite a lot at that price -- with an emphasis on "at that price."Keeping costs down means stripping out all of the frills. The tablet does come loaded with a recent version of the Android operating system, Jellybean 4.1 (only Jellybean 4.2 is newer). That means access to all of the Google services, like Gmail, Google Play, Google Now, Chrome, Maps and YouTube, as well as the most recent versions of third-party apps.The tablet's hardware is good but entry level by current standards. For instance, the 1.1 GHz processor in the Genesis would have been top of the line a couple of years ago, but in watching streaming videos over Wi-Fi, it lagged a little.The tablet is also Wi-Fi only, so if there is no hot spot, there is no Web access. The device has limited memory, with only four gigabytes on board. But there is a slot that can take a 32 GB micro SD memory card (that will add at least $20 to the price). Ematic also includes five GB of cloud storage with the tablet.The tablet has only one physical button, the on/off switch. The rest of the controls are on the screen. That has to save a few dollars, right?The screen itself is reasonably sharp, but very small type, like that on the apps page, breaks up a bit. And the screen has a subtle blue tint, which you probably won't notice watching movies but which is apparent on print pages with white backgrounds.The only camera is a front-facing VGA, so this is not the first choice for photo buffs. And the speaker is particularly anemic, although when using headphones the sound quality was good.Battery life isn't stellar, with the manufacturer estimating a 4.5-hour play time.It would be easy to write off this tablet based on the specifications, but don't forget the one spec that really sets it apart-- the $80 price

Reviews.Title: $80 tablet, mixed feelings
Reviews.Author: Jake Jacobs "DiscDirect"
Reviews.Content: I have not had a tablet before.  Never even used one.  Had decided to buy the iPad mini when I saw the product announcement for this.  For $80, I decided to chance it.  I've now had it about 18 days.  It works.  It's small, it's lightweight.  Oh, also it's quite elegant looking.I've watched a bit of video on it on YouTube & Netflix. It looks good to me. Typing on the tiny keyboard is awkward @ best, but I imagine the iPad mini's keyboard would be as much of a challenge.  Instruction manual is VERY brief, & I wish there was more to it. In order to use Netflix, you need to download an application, but can't do so fr. N-flix site, must get the app fr. Google store (free). I've read e-mails, but can't figure out how to search my e-mails for a particular 1 (I can do this on my desktop), nor have I figured out how to send e-mails (this too, I can do on my desktop - I'm not a total moron). On YouTube I have twice found the search function for the site, but it isn't intuitive & I'm still not sure how to find it again. Also, the 2nd (last) time I found the search function, & entered my search item, nothing happened, so WTF?  &, of course, I don't know if these problems would be any different on any other tablet, @ least 1 w/a screen this small (7 inch, I think).  Sound from the speaker is very tinny, but seems quite good w/ear buds.The very first thing you're supposed to do when you turn it on, is connect it to your desktop in order to load device drivers.  I did, but no device drivers loaded.  A week later, I found out how to bring it back to factory settings, so I could try again.  Same thing - no device drivers.  My desktop doesn't recognize my tablet so I can't move files - I suppose this could be because I use Windows XP - but there's no way to know.I was alerted that there is a software upgrade available. I downloaded it, but the download didn't complete, & now I can't find it again.  Grrrrrr.I've gone to the ematic website from my desktop. Documentation that came with the tablet directed me to their site and a section of FAQ.  There aren't any FAQ.  There is a search function.  No matter what you enter, it returns an answer that nothing was found and directs you to submit a question, but the form for the questions refers to another company, not Ematic, and is for submitting warrantee claims for broken parts.  Their website says they'll reply w/in 24 hours.  They don't reply at all.For $80, vs. maybe $400 plus, it was worth the experiment, I think.  Again, I'm a novice @ this, so I may be missing all sorts of issues.  However, knowing what I know now, I'd spend more money and hope for a better tablet.

Reviews.Title: awful tablet
Reviews.Author: BLee
Reviews.Content: this tablet is virtually useless for browsing: incredibly slow and ceases to work altogether often. the display is poor, and there is very limited memory for apps: although there is a slot for cd card, the memory can only be used for data and not for apps. the only thing the tablet is good for is for playing mp3 music, and barely adequate for reading ebooks.I regret purchasing this product, and strongly recommend anyone to avoid it at all cost. Use the money to buy an ebook reader, e.g. KIndle, instead.

Reviews.Title: Children love it!
Reviews.Author: D. Aldridge
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these tablets for my sons ages 6 & 9 and they love them. Works great and because my children love downloading games, I would suggest purchasing additional memory. It loads and charges quickly (good for impatient children :)), and the battery life is good as well. Chrome is installed but I'd recommended downloading Opera Mini because Chrome is very slow. Overall it is a good tablet especially for the price and we love it!

Reviews.Title: Too slow for my use.
Reviews.Author: Tired
Reviews.Content: Tested it side by side with my laptop and Note 2. Much slower than either. Plan was to use it in office with EMR. Gave it away

Reviews.Title: Very Slow and buggy
Reviews.Author: Ariel
Reviews.Content: Got this tablet for my mom,  I guess you get what you pay for.the build on the tablet is good,  but it is very slow and buggy.facebook would close itself. most apps would run very slowly.I recommend you save some money and buy a kindle HD or a Nexus 7

Reviews.Title: Can't Beat For The Price!
Reviews.Author: CAJ
Reviews.Content: Again for the price you can't beat it -$79.99.  No it doesn't have the screen resolution of higher priced tablets but its quite adequate and no it isn't as fast and smooth as higher priced ones, but adequate..  It runs all or most apps on Google Play.  It has a 7" screen and small casing overall - perfect for home and travel. We mostly used it for games like 'words with friends' card games and wifi control apps for household functions.  It also has what most higher priced tablets don't - a micro SD slot that can increase your storage up to 32 GB.  Internet access is very good using Chrome or native browser.  Earphones - yes.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Wonder as I Wander "just wandering"
Reviews.Content: Brought this for the little one so she could stop using the adults more expensive ipad and kindle, however I fell in love with this easy to use and very fast tablet.  It one upped the kindle with a front facing camera and google talk.  Very nice buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: kid friendly
Reviews.Author: Hall901
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a 6 year old boy.  it is has survived a few drops already. Very happy with this purchase

Reviews.Title: Fault advertising.
Reviews.Author: Tainu Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Slow to a halt, doesn't do and perform like a tablet. Like to return it if possible, it's a rip off.

Reviews.Title: Cool tablet
Reviews.Author: Russell Stahlke
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a quality tablet.  Apps run fine and so do movies.  Of course it is not as fast as a more expensive tablet, but it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Great grandchild's Gift
Reviews.Author: peggy Daniel
Reviews.Content: This put a smile on my great grand daughters face and now we cant get her to stop playing with it she loves this and so do i

Reviews.Title: Genesis 7" Tablet
Reviews.Author: nadene
Reviews.Content: I bought two of this product a little over a week ago for my children and so far I have not seen much problem with them. The memory is limited though and sometimes the tablet does not respond to the touch; we have to jab at the screen sometimes for it to respond.

Reviews.Title: I want new headphones and a car charger
Reviews.Author: Leslie Jones McCloud
Reviews.Content: This tablet is decent for the money. I purchased my tablet at Walmart for $59 and at first I could not download the Instagram app on it. I even wrote the developer. Then I figured out how to do it.Go here: [...]Anyway, the memory filled up quickly, even after moving many apps to the sd card (internal). I thought I was putting the apps on the external sd mini card but I don't know how to get them over there and the instructions that came with this product are bare bones. Not big on customer support, I guess. I can listen to sounds easier while falling asleep,I can take this in the kitchen with me for cooking and watching ON Demand videos and cooking vids so it is handy for the $$. I have not had it long but it is useful.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: ROBERT E. DUNCAN
Reviews.Content: I HAVE USED THIS PRODUCT FOR OVER 3 WEEKS AND I AM COMPLETELY SATIFIED. HAS A NUMBER OF GREAT FEATURES AND IS VERY PORTABLE. THERE ARE SOME APPS OUT THERE WHICH WILL NOT WORK WITH UNIT BUT MAY WORK IN FUTURE ONCE THE THE APPS ARE FURTHER DEVELOPED. I ALSO LIKE IT'S EXPANDABLE SD MEMORY CAPABILITY. THE PRICE IS RIGHT AND I'M THINKING OF PURCHASING ANOTHER UNIT VERY SOON.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Nema
Reviews.Content: This Tablet is easy to learn and the ease of finding what you need to know is wonderful! I would recommened this Tablet to anyone who wants a great Tablet!

Reviews.Title: I LIKE IT
Reviews.Author: Olatunde Stephen
Reviews.Content: I USE IT TO LISTEN TO MUSICLISTEN TO GOSPEL.... PREACHING FROM TBNTHOUGH.. I WILL UPGRADE IT SOON ....

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: D. Andrew Gelsinger
Reviews.Content: A great kids tablet.  A little slow and clunky sometimes - but for the price, you can't beat it!  Pretty tough too!  This thing has taken a beating from an almost 2 year old, and still keeps ticking!

Reviews.Title: Fills a need
Reviews.Author: KipOc
Reviews.Content: I needed a tablet that could access the Playstore, this fit the bill.  I have had it mounted on a wall in a factory running a time-clock app for a couple of months. It is powered on 24 hrs, 7 days a week.  I have never had a problem with it, never had to restart it.  Granted, it's only running a single app.  It is SLOW so regular users may be frustrated by that.

Reviews.Title: Poor design
Reviews.Author: R.AZARUDEEN
Reviews.Content: There is no way to connect the internet other than the wifi, i dislike this item.No camera on both sides..No GSM facilityNo mobile networks facility.Only one port available.Headset was not desirable.

Reviews.Title: Poorly manufactured, 3 units, 3 different problems
Reviews.Author: Peter D. White "pedrobot"
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these for my sons for Christmas.  Right out of the box, one wouldn't turn on - the on/off button was broken.  Sent it back for a replacement.  Replacement unit arrived, and its charger was broken.  Attempted to charge unit using the charger from the other one, but it would only operate if plugged into the wall - the battery wouldn't hold a charge at all.  The other one would only intermittently connect to my home wi-fi (all my other devices work great).  To have 3 different manufacturing problems on 3 different units is a real concern.  In the brief time that I did have one of these things working, I found the performance to be iffy, and the lack of storage space appalling.  You cannot install apps on an installed SD card on this device, so ultimately you have less than 2 GB total for downloaded apps.  I returned all of them, and will try another product.

Reviews.Title: Does not work within 2 hours of running
Reviews.Author: Courtney Mixer
Reviews.Content: Website for product does not reply, no FAQ section, even though it states they do. Can not download ANY apps and can not restart the system. The cheapest tablet I have ever seen. DOES NOT WORK. Keeps saying Android processing fails.  Just ordered the kindle at this point and hope it actually works! You will be disappointed if you order this, the processor/software is flawed from the get go!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: al
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a backup to my wife's Kindle when she had to send in her Kindle for repairs. This thing is pretty slow. I wasn't expecting much after doing all the research on it, and I wasn't disappointed. But if you are expecting something useful as a tablet, you may regret the purchase. Not a lot of internal storage and not a lot of speed. It can barely run Pandora which is the secondary purpose I got it for. As an e-reader, it gets the job done.Would have given it 3 stars but the battery does not hold a charge for a long time when not in use. This may or may not be specific to my device. If you are looking for a cheap 7 inch tablet under $100, I would suggest spending a little more on a refurbished name-brand tablet.

Reviews.Title: Don't do it.
Reviews.Author: Megan
Reviews.Content: This tablet works as expected for the price. My personal one's touch screen is delayed and hard to touch, the memory is small, and apps generally run slow. The other one that was purchased does not work at all anymore. It worked the same as mine for a week, then it stopped charging and the same day that it stopped charging the charging port fell completely out when the charger was unplugged. I probably would not order again.

Reviews.Title: two months....
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: About the end of first month it stopped charging regularly. At the end of the second month it wont charge at all anymore. It was a bad purchase.

Reviews.Title: $59.99 at Walmart website
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Treat the people around you ...
Reviews.Content: I've got the 'priceblink' app on my browser & whenI looked at this page 'priceblink' popped up to notify me that this is $60 at Walmart- I hope that helps you

Reviews.Title: Good for kids
Reviews.Author: Sassy Mama
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my 6 yr old who broke his first tablet. This one seems to be a bit more 'kid-proof'. The price is GREAT. Includes everything a kid needs in a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Not Worth The Money!
Reviews.Author: Tee B
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tablet for my niece's birthday.  After reading some of the negative reviews, I decided to give it a chance anyway.  I ordered it a month in advance of her birthday in order to test it to make sure it worked properly.  At first, it worked OK.  It was kinda slow, but I expected as much based on the cost.  After a playing with it a few days and testing the battery, the charge port fell out.  It still had some battery life when this happened, but now the device will not even come on.  I am disappointed because I don't want to spend a large sum of money on a table for a 10 year old, but I had to return this item.

ProductInfo.Features:
Android 4.1 Jelly Bean, 7.0 inches Display
1.1 GHz ARMv7
4 GB Flash Memory, 0.5 GB RAM Memory
4.5-hour battery life, 0.6 pounds
ProductInfo.Name: Ematic EGS004-PR 7.0-Inch 4GB Genesis Prime MultiTouch Tablet (Purple)
